description: Configuration file for LAI-PrEP Bridge Period Decision Support Tool

MSM.name: Men who have sex with men
MSM.clinical_notes: MSM: Address stigma, privacy concerns, and social network disclosure. HPTN 083 showed 89% relative risk reduction.

CISGENDER_WOMEN.name: Cisgender women
CISGENDER_WOMEN.clinical_notes: Women: Address medical mistrust, structural barriers (transportation, childcare). HPTN 084 showed 89% superior efficacy; PURPOSE-1 had zero infections in 5,338 women.

TRANSGENDER_WOMEN.name: Transgender women
TRANSGENDER_WOMEN.clinical_notes: Transgender women: Address healthcare discrimination, hormone interaction concerns. PURPOSE-2 showed 96% reduction in HIV incidence across all gender identities.

ADOLESCENT.name: Adolescent (16-24 years)
ADOLESCENT.evidence_source: PURPOSE-1 adolescent cohort (n=56 aged 16-17), oral PrEP extrapolation
ADOLESCENT.clinical_notes: Adolescents: Address temporal discounting, transportation dependence, privacy concerns. PURPOSE-1 demonstrated zero infections in 56 adolescents aged 16-17.

PWID.name: People who inject drugs
PWID.clinical_notes: PWID: Harm reduction approach essential. No abstinence requirement. PURPOSE-4 trial (ongoing) will provide critical implementation evidence.

PREGNANT_LACTATING.name: Pregnant/lactating individuals
PREGNANT_LACTATING.evidence_source: PURPOSE-1 inclusion, extrapolated from general women data
PREGNANT_LACTATING.clinical_notes: Pregnant/lactating: Address pregnancy-specific concerns, competing priorities. PURPOSE-1 first trial to include pregnant/lactating individuals from the beginning.

GENERAL.name: General population
GENERAL.clinical_notes: General population: Standard protocols appropriate. Focus on efficient bridge period navigation.

TRANSPORTATION.name: Transportation barriers
TRANSPORTATION.description: Lack of reliable transportation to multiple appointments

CHILDCARE.name: Childcare needs
CHILDCARE.description: Need for childcare during medical appointments

HOUSING_INSTABILITY.name: Housing instability
HOUSING_INSTABILITY.description: Homelessness or unstable housing affecting follow-up

SCHEDULING_CONFLICTS.name: Scheduling conflicts
SCHEDULING_CONFLICTS.description: Work, school, or other commitments preventing appointment attendance

MEDICAL_MISTRUST.name: Medical mistrust
MEDICAL_MISTRUST.description: Historical and ongoing experiences of medical racism and discrimination

PRIVACY_CONCERNS.name: Privacy/confidentiality concerns
PRIVACY_CONCERNS.description: Concerns about disclosure of sexual activity or HIV prevention

HEALTHCARE_DISCRIMINATION.name: Healthcare discrimination experience
HEALTHCARE_DISCRIMINATION.description: Past experiences of discrimination in healthcare settings

COMPETING_PRIORITIES.name: Competing health/life priorities
COMPETING_PRIORITIES.description: Other health needs or life circumstances taking precedence

LIMITED_NAVIGATION_EXPERIENCE.name: Limited healthcare navigation experience
LIMITED_NAVIGATION_EXPERIENCE.description: Lack of experience scheduling appointments and coordinating care

LEGAL_CONCERNS.name: Criminalization/legal concerns
LEGAL_CONCERNS.description: Fear of legal consequences from healthcare engagement

LACK_IDENTIFICATION.name: Lack of government ID
LACK_IDENTIFICATION.description: Missing identification documents required for care

SUBSTANCE_USE.name: Active substance use
SUBSTANCE_USE.description: Active substance use affecting appointment attendance (harm reduction: no abstinence required)

ORAL_TO_INJECTABLE.name: Oral-to-injectable transition
ORAL_TO_INJECTABLE.evidence_source: CAN Community Health Network, Ryan White clinics oral-to-LA-ART data
ORAL_TO_INJECTABLE.note: 1.5-fold improvement in relative odds. Eliminates most bridge barriers. 85-90% success vs 53% baseline.

SAME_DAY_SWITCHING.name: Same-day switching protocol
SAME_DAY_SWITCHING.note: If HIV testing within 7 days, can inject same day. Completely eliminates bridge period.

PATIENT_NAVIGATION.name: Patient navigation program
PATIENT_NAVIGATION.evidence_source: San Francisco PrEP navigation (HR 1.5), cancer care meta-analyses (10-40% improvement)
PATIENT_NAVIGATION.note: 1.5-fold increase in initiation rate. Particularly effective for populations with structural barriers.

ACCELERATED_TESTING.name: Accelerated HIV testing (RNA + Ag/Ab)
ACCELERATED_TESTING.evidence_source: WHO July 2025 guidance, window period literature
ACCELERATED_TESTING.note: RNA testing reduces window period from 33-45 days to 10-14 days. Compresses bridge duration.

TRANSPORTATION_SUPPORT.name: Transportation vouchers/support
TRANSPORTATION_SUPPORT.evidence_source: Cancer care transportation studies, PrEP barrier literature
TRANSPORTATION_SUPPORT.note: Key barrier for women and PWID populations. Ride-share partnerships or transit vouchers.

CHILDCARE_SUPPORT.name: Childcare vouchers/on-site care
CHILDCARE_SUPPORT.note: Critical for women with caregiving responsibilities. On-site or voucher support.

TEXT_MESSAGE_NAVIGATION.name: SMS/text message navigation
TEXT_MESSAGE_NAVIGATION.note: SMS reminders improve appointment attendance by 20-30%. Low-cost, high-reach.

PEER_NAVIGATION.name: Peer navigator support
PEER_NAVIGATION.evidence_source: HIV care cascade peer navigation studies
PEER_NAVIGATION.note: Particularly effective for key populations with lived experience. Greater effect than non-peer navigation.

TELEHEALTH_COUNSELING.name: Telehealth bridge counseling
TELEHEALTH_COUNSELING.note: Reduces visit burden but still requires in-person testing/injection.

EXPEDITED_AUTHORIZATION.name: Expedited insurance authorization
EXPEDITED_AUTHORIZATION.note: Insurance delays are major cause of bridge period attrition. Expedited pathways essential.

MOBILE_DELIVERY.name: Mobile/community-based delivery
MOBILE_DELIVERY.evidence_source: Mobile clinic HIV services, community-based models
MOBILE_DELIVERY.note: Brings services to patients, eliminates transportation barrier. Requires infrastructure investment.

HARM_REDUCTION_INTEGRATION.name: SSP/harm reduction integration
HARM_REDUCTION_INTEGRATION.evidence_source: PURPOSE-4 trial design, SSP integration models
HARM_REDUCTION_INTEGRATION.note: Essential for PWID - leverages existing trust. PURPOSE-4 will provide implementation evidence.

BUNDLED_PAYMENT.name: Bundled payment model
BUNDLED_PAYMENT.evidence_source: Value-based payment models in preventive care
BUNDLED_PAYMENT.note: Reduces authorization delays and administrative burden. System-level intervention.

MEDICAL_MISTRUST_INTERVENTION.name: Medical mistrust intervention
MEDICAL_MISTRUST_INTERVENTION.note: Culturally concordant care and community health worker support to address medical mistrust.

ANTI_DISCRIMINATION_PROTOCOLS.name: Anti-discrimination protocols
ANTI_DISCRIMINATION_PROTOCOLS.note: Staff training and policies to prevent discrimination.

CONFIDENTIALITY_PROTECTIONS.name: Enhanced confidentiality protections
CONFIDENTIALITY_PROTECTIONS.note: Stronger privacy protections for adolescents and populations with privacy concerns.

FLEXIBLE_SCHEDULING.name: Flexible scheduling options
FLEXIBLE_SCHEDULING.note: Extended hours, weekend appointments, walk-in options.

LOW_BARRIER_PROTOCOLS.name: Low-barrier access protocols
LOW_BARRIER_PROTOCOLS.note: Reduced documentation requirements, no abstinence requirement, accepting care where people are.

PREGNANCY_COUNSELING.name: Pregnancy-specific PrEP counseling
PREGNANCY_COUNSELING.note: Specialized counseling addressing pregnancy and lactation concerns.

PRENATAL_INTEGRATION.name: Prenatal care integration
PRENATAL_INTEGRATION.note: LAI-PrEP services integrated into prenatal care visits.

INSURANCE_SUPPORT.name: Insurance navigation support
INSURANCE_SUPPORT.note: Assistance with insurance enrollment, authorization processes, and appeals.

LOW.label: Low attrition risk
LOW.clinical_action: Standard protocols appropriate. Minimal intervention required.

MODERATE.label: Moderate attrition risk
MODERATE.clinical_action: Standard navigation recommended. Monitor for barriers.

HIGH.label: High attrition risk
HIGH.clinical_action: Prioritize navigation and barrier removal. Multiple interventions may be needed.

VERY_HIGH.label: Very high attrition risk
VERY_HIGH.clinical_action: Multiple intensive interventions required. Consider harm reduction or community-based models.

oral_prep_transition_priority.message: Currently on oral PrEP: PRIORITY for transition pathway. 85-90% initiation success vs 53% for PrEP-naive.

discontinued_oral_prep.message: Discontinued oral PrEP: LAI-PrEP addresses adherence challenges that led to discontinuation. ~50% discontinue oral PrEP within 6-12 months.

medical_mistrust.message: Medical mistrust present. Provide culturally concordant support; acknowledge historical/ongoing medical racism.

housing_instability.message: Housing instability complicates follow-up. Ensure multiple contact methods; consider mobile/community-based delivery.

pharmacy_setting.message: Pharmacy-based care: Leverage extended hours and convenient access. Address reimbursement and private space barriers.

harm_reduction_setting.message: Harm reduction setting: Ideal for PWID populations. Low-barrier protocols, no abstinence requirement.

evidence_base.message: Evidence: >15,000 participants across HPTN 083, 084, PURPOSE-1, PURPOSE-2. >96% efficacy, 81-83% persistence once initiated.

evidence_sources.purpose_1: n=5,338 cisgender women including 56 adolescents aged 16-17
